subject: AccuWeather.com Alert(tm) Advisory  (avcavc)
body:
AccuWeather.com Alert[TM]






















 







							Severe Watches and Warnings for BEVERLY HILLS 













LOXCFWLOX
WHUS46 KLOX 110955
CFWLOX

COASTAL HAZARD MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE LOS ANGELES/OXNARD CA
255 AM PDT WED APR 11 2007

..HIGH SURF TO AFFECT SOUTH FACING BEACHES OF SOUTHWESTERN
CALIFORNIA...

STRONG WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW OVER THE COASTAL WATERS WILL GENERATE A
SOMEWHAT LARGE WESTERLY SWELL. IN ADDITION...A MODERATE SOUTHERLY SWELL
HAS ALSO BEGUN TO BUILD. THIS COMBINATION OF WESTERLY AND SOUTHERLY
SWELLS WILL PRODUCE HIGH SURF ALONG THE BEACHES OF CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN
CALIFORNIA THROUGH THURSDAY.

CAZ034-035-111100-
/O.CAN.KLOX.SU.Y.0005.000000T0000Z-070411T1000Z/
SAN LUIS OBISPO COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY CENTRAL COAST-
255 AM PDT WED APR 11 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED FOR THE CENTRAL COAST...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS CANCELLED THE
HIGH SURF ADVISORY.

SIX TO EIGHT FOOT BREAKERS WITH MAXIMUM SETS TO NINE FEET CAN BE
EXPECTED THROUGH THE MORNING ON EXPOSED WEST AND SOUTHWEST FACING
BEACHES...WITH DANGEROUS RIP CURRENTS POSSIBLE. SURF WILL SUBSIDE
TODAY BUT IS EXPECTED TO REBUILD ON THURSDAY AND MAY REQUIRE
ANOTHER HIGH SURF ADVISORY.

$$

CAZ040-041-111600-
/O.CAN.KLOX.CF.S.0003.000000T0000Z-070413T0600Z/
/O.NEW.KLOX.SU.Y.0006.070411T1000Z-070413T0600Z/
VENTURA COUNTY COAST-
LOS ANGELES COUNTY COAST INCLUDING DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES-
255 AM PDT WED APR 11 2007

..HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THURSDAY...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN LOS ANGELES/OXNARD HAS ISSUED A HIGH
SURF ADVISORY...WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM PDT THURSDAY.

FIVE TO SEVEN FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED ALONG FAVORABLY EXPOSED
SOUTH FACING BEACHES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. MAXIMUM SETS UP TO
NINE FEET AND DANGEROUS RIP CURRENTS ARE POSSIBLE. SURF SHOULD
PEAK TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...THEN DIMINISH THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

A HIGH SURF ADVISORY MEANS THAT HIGH SURF WILL AFFECT BEACHES IN THE
ADVISORY AREA...PRODUCING RIP CURRENTS AND LOCALIZED BEACH EROSION.
IT IS EXTREMELY DANGEROUS TO FISH OR OBSERVE WAVES FROM EXPOSED
COASTAL STRUCTURES OR ROCKS DURING HIGH SURF CONDITIONS. VERY LARGE
WAVES CAN SUDDENLY SWEEP ACROSS PREVIOUSLY DRY AREAS. SWIMMING OR
SURFING IN THESE WAVES MAY BE DANGEROUS FOR ANYONE.

$$

CAZ039-111100-
/O.CAN.KLOX.CF.S.0003.000000T0000Z-070413T0600Z/
SANTA BARBARA COUNTY SOUTH COAST-
255 AM PDT WED APR 11 2007

THREE TO FIVE FOOT BREAKERS ARE EXPECTED ALONG FAVORABLY EXPOSED
SOUTHWEST FACING BEACHES THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT. MAXIMUM SETS UP
TO SIX FEET ARE POSSIBLE ON THE MOST EXPOSED SOUTH FACING
BEACHES...AND DANGEROUS RIP CURRENTS ARE POSSIBLE. SURF SHOULD
PEAK TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...THEN DIMINISH THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

$$

MEIER
